scenarios.name: Successful User Login and Company Selection
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can successfully log in with valid credentials and select their designated company to access the main application dashboard.
user_journey: Navigate to the Application URL.
Locate the email input field and enter the user's email address.
Click the 'Continue' button.
Wait for the password field to appear and enter the user's password.
Click the 'Login' button.
Wait for the company selection page to load.
Locate the specified company name and click on it to select it.
acceptance_criteria: The login page is displayed successfully.
After entering valid credentials, the user is authenticated.
The company selection page is displayed with a list of companies.
Upon selecting a company, the user is successfully navigated to the main application dashboard.

scenarios.name: Successful User Invitation and Onboarding Workflow
scenarios.description: Verifies that an admin user can successfully invite a new user, and the invitation can be accepted to create a new, active user account.
user_journey: As an admin, navigate to the 'Administration' dropdown and click 'Manage Users'.
Click the 'Invite Users' button.
Enter the new user's email in the 'Email' input field.
Set the 'Admin' checkbox according to the test data.
Click the 'Send Invite' button.
Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section and find the invited user's email.
Click the tick/checkmark symbol in the Actions column for the invited user.
On the 'Accept Invite' form, enter the user's 'First Name'.
Enter the user's 'Last Name'.
Enter and confirm the 'Create Password' for the new user.
Click the 'Accept Invite' button to complete the account creation.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Invite Users' modal opens successfully.
The invitation is sent and a confirmation is received.
The invited user appears correctly in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
The 'Accept Invite' form is displayed after clicking the accept action.
The new user account is created successfully upon submitting the form.
The application navigates to the dashboard or a success page after account creation.

scenarios.name: Successful Creation of a Formula-Based Metric with Weekly Cadence
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can create a new metric using the Formula Builder, correctly constructing a formula with two existing metrics and a 'Weekly' cadence which requires selecting a 'Resets On' day.
user_journey: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the main menu.
Click the 'Add Metric' button.
Enter the 'Metric Name' in the name input field.
Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
In the Formula Builder, search for and select the 'First Metric'.
Click the specified 'Operator' button.
Search for and select the 'Second Metric'.
Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
Select 'Weekly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
Verify the 'Resets On' dropdown appears.
Select the specified day from the 'Resets On' dropdown.
Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
acceptance_criteria: The metric creation form appears.
The Formula Builder interface is displayed when 'Formula' is selected as the value source.
Metrics can be successfully searched and added to the formula.
The formula is constructed and validated successfully.
The 'Resets On' field correctly appears only when 'Weekly' cadence is selected.
The new metric is saved successfully and a confirmation is received.

scenarios.name: Successfully Adding a Newly Created Metric to 'My Dashboard KPIs'
scenarios.description: Verifies that a user can find a newly created metric and add it to their 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
user_journey: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
Locate the 'My KPIs' section and click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
In the 'Edit KPI' modal, locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
Click the metric in the left panel.
Verify the metric automatically moves to the right panel (selected KPIs).
Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
acceptance_criteria: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens and displays available and selected metrics.
The newly created metric is found in the available metrics list.
Clicking the metric successfully moves it to the selected KPIs list.
The modal closes upon saving.
The dashboard refreshes and the new metric card is visible in the 'My KPIs' section.
test_data_requirements: Metric_Name (of a metric that has been created but not yet added to the dashboard)

scenarios.name: Successful Configuration of a 'Custom' Target for a Dashboard Metric
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can edit a metric from the dashboard, navigate to the target configuration, and successfully set and save a 'Custom' target with four performance levels.
user_journey: On the 'My Dashboard' page, locate the correct metric card.
Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
On the Edit page, click the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Select the 'Custom' radio button.
Enter the 'Level 1' target value.
Enter the 'Level 2' target value.
Enter the 'Level 3' target value.
Enter the 'Level 4' target value.
Click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The three-dot menu on the metric card opens successfully.
The user is navigated to the metric's Edit page.
The 'Custom' target input fields appear after selecting the 'Custom' radio button.
All four target level values are entered successfully.
The target configuration is saved without errors.
The user is navigated back to the dashboard.
The metric card on the dashboard now displays visual indicators for the configured custom target.
test_data_requirements: Metric_Name (of a metric on the dashboard)

scenarios.name: Successful Configuration of a 'Time-Based' Target for a Dashboard Metric
scenarios.description: Verifies a user can edit a metric from the dashboard, navigate to the target configuration, and successfully set and save a 'Time-Based' target with a start and target value.
user_journey: On the 'My Dashboard' page, locate the correct metric card.
Hover over the metric card to reveal the three-dot menu button.
Click the three-dot menu button to open the dropdown.
Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
On the Edit page, click the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
Enter the 'Start Value' in its input field.
Enter the 'Target Value' in its input field.
Click the 'Save' button.
acceptance_criteria: The three-dot menu on the metric card opens successfully.
The user is navigated to the metric's Edit page.
The 'Time-Based' target input fields appear after selecting the 'Time-Based' radio button.
The Start and Target values are entered successfully.
The target configuration is saved without errors.
The user is navigated back to the dashboard.
The metric card on the dashboard now displays a progress indicator reflecting the configured time-based target.
test_data_requirements: Metric_Name (of a metric on the dashboard)

dependencies: A valid, active user account with sufficient permissions must exist for login.
The test data must be provided via a correctly formatted Excel sheet with all required columns.
The company specified in the test data must exist and be assigned to the login user.
For formula creation, the metrics specified ('First_Metric', 'Second_Metric') must already exist in the system.
A clean test environment is required, or a reliable teardown script must be run between tests to prevent data duplication (e.g., duplicate users or metrics) which could cause locator failures.
